(A.9.4) AI system's intended use and lim.WebFormTitle: Document the AI system's intended use and limitations.

Fields.Control: A.9.4 – Intended use of the AI system
Fields.FieldName: (A.9.4) - AI System - ID
Fields.FieldText: AI System Unique Number

Fields.Control: A.9.4 – Intended use of the AI system
Fields.FieldName: (A.9.4) - AI System - Name
Fields.FieldText: Name of the AI application

Fields.Control: A.9.4 – Intended use of the AI system
Fields.FieldName: (A.9.4) - AI System - Target Users
Fields.FieldText: Who are the Target Users of the Ai system?

Fields.Control: A.9.4 – Intended use of the AI system
Fields.FieldName: (A.9.4) - AI System - Business Purpose
Fields.FieldText: What specific business problem or task does this system address?

Fields.Control: A.9.4 – Intended use of the AI system
Fields.FieldName: (A.9.4) - AI System - Intended Use
Fields.FieldText: Describe the use cases of how the AI system will solve the specific business problem or task

(A.9.3) Objectives for Responsible and E.WebFormTitle: Describe the Responsible and Ethical objectives to guide the use of AI systems.

Fields.Control: A.9.3 – Objectives for responsible use of AI system
Fields.FieldName: (9.3) - Responsible AI Objectives Use - Performance and Fairness Monitoring
Fields.FieldText: To continuously monitor the AI system's performance and fairness in the live environment to promptly detect and address model drift or emergent biases.

Fields.Control: A.9.3 – Objectives for responsible use of AI system
Fields.FieldName: (9.3) - Responsible AI Objectives Use - Human Oversight
Fields.FieldText: To ensure that all required human oversight and intervention procedures are consistently followed for AI-generated decisions, especially in high-risk scenarios.

Fields.Control: A.9.3 – Objectives for responsible use of AI system
Fields.FieldName: (9.3) - Responsible AI Objectives Use - Adherence to Intended Use
Fields.FieldText: To ensure the AI system is used strictly within its defined and approved scope, and to prevent its application in unauthorized or unintended contexts.

Fields.Control: A.9.3 – Objectives for responsible use of AI system
Fields.FieldName: (9.3) - Responsible AI Objectives Use - Incident Management
Fields.FieldText: To establish and maintain a responsive process for identifying, reporting, and remediating incidents or adverse outcomes resulting from the AI system's operation.

Fields.Control: A.9.3 – Objectives for responsible use of AI system
Fields.FieldName: (9.3) - Responsible AI Objectives Use - Operational Transparency
Fields.FieldText: To provide clear and timely communication to users and affected stakeholders about the AI system's presence, capabilities, and limitations during its operation.

Fields.Control: A.9.3 – Objectives for responsible use of AI system
Fields.FieldName: (9.3) - Responsible AI Objectives Use - Data Management
Fields.FieldText: To apply data protection and privacy principles to all data processed by the AI system in the production environment, in line with legal and policy requirements.

Fields.Control: A.9.3 – Objectives for responsible use of AI system
Fields.FieldName: (9.3) - Responsible AI Objectives Use - System Maintenance
Fields.FieldText: To maintain the AI system through regular updates, security patches, and performance reviews, and to manage its eventual decommissioning responsibly.

(A.6.2.2) AI system's Functional Require.WebFormTitle: Specify and document all requirements for new AI systems or for material enhancements to existing systems.

Fields.Control: 6.2.2 – AI system requirements and specification
Fields.FieldName: (A.6.2.2) - AI System Functional Requirement - Processing Logic
Fields.FieldText: What’s the core logic or model behavior expected?

Fields.Control: 6.2.2 – AI system requirements and specification
Fields.FieldName: (A.6.2.2) - AI System Functional Requirement - Outputs
Fields.FieldText: What outputs should the system produce?

Fields.Control: 6.2.2 – AI system requirements and specification
Fields.FieldName: (A.6.2.2) - AI System Functional Requirement - Interaction Model
Fields.FieldText: Will it run in the background, have a UI, API, etc.?

Fields.Control: 6.2.2 – AI system requirements and specification
Fields.FieldName: (A.6.2.2) - AI System Functional Requirement - Performance
Fields.FieldText: Are there any SLA's associated with the AI system?

Fields.Control: 6.2.2 – AI system requirements and specification
Fields.FieldName: (A.6.2.2) - AI System Functional Requirement - Compliance
Fields.FieldText: Are there regulations or policies it must follow? (e.g., GDPR, AI Act)

AI Act Prohibited Practices Assessment.WebFormTitle: Determine if the AI system is prohibited

Fields.FieldName: Prohibited Practices - Subliminal Manipulation
Fields.FieldText: Does the AI system deploy techniques beyond a person's consciousness to materially distort their behavior in a way that is likely to cause harm?

Fields.FieldName: Prohibited Practices - Exploitation of Vulnerabilities
Fields.FieldText: Does the AI system exploit vulnerabilities of a specific group (e.g., due to age, physical or mental disability, social or economic situation) to materially distort their behavior in a way likely to cause harm to that person or another?

Fields.FieldName: Prohibited Practices - Social Scoring
Fields.FieldText: Is the AI system used by public authorities for evaluating or classifying the trustworthiness of natural persons based on their social behavior or personal characteristics, leading to detrimental or unfavorable treatment?

Fields.FieldName: Prohibited Practices - Real-time Remote Biometric Identification
Fields.FieldText: Is the AI system used by law enforcement for real-time remote biometric identification of natural persons in publicly accessible spaces? (Note: Very limited exceptions exist)

Fields.FieldName: Prohibited Practices - Emotion Inference
Fields.FieldText: Does the AI system infer emotions of natural persons in the context of workplaces or educational institutions?

Fields.FieldName: Prohibited Practices - Biometric Categorization
Fields.FieldText: Does the AI system use biometric data to categorize natural persons based on sensitive attributes like race, political opinions, trade union membership, religious or philosophical beliefs, or sexual orientation?

Fields.FieldName: Prohibited Practices - Untargeted Scraping of Facial Images
Fields.FieldText: Does the AI system involve untargeted scraping of facial images from the internet or CCTV footage to create or expand facial recognition databases?

Fields.FieldName: Prohibited Practices - Risk Assessment of Criminal Offenses (Profiling)
Fields.FieldText: Does the AI system assess the risk of a natural person committing a criminal offense based solely on profiling or assessment of their personality traits or characteristics?

Fields.FieldName: Prohibited Practices - AI system is Prohibited
Fields.FieldText: If the answer to any of these questions is "Yes," the AI system may be prohibited under the AI Act.||For a more detailed assessment, you can refer to the EU AI Act Compliance Checker: https://artificialintelligenceact.eu/assessment/eu-ai-act-compliance-checker/

Decision point.WebFormTitle: If the system is Prohibited then Exit else continue to next step.

Fields.FieldName: Prohibited Practices - AI system is Prohibited
Fields.FieldLabel: FieldName = the field to interigate to determine the decision branch.
Fields.FieldText:
If the answer to any of these questions is "Yes," the AI system may be prohibited under the AI Act.
For a more detailed assessment, you can refer to the EU AI Act Compliance Checker||https://artificialintelligenceact.eu/assessment/eu-ai-act-compliance-checker/
Fields.FieldType: Decision:Yes=Document AI system approvals/No=Determine the AI system's Data Sensitivity & Privacy impact

Fields.FieldName: AI System Significance - Data Sensitivity & Privacy - Process, store, or interpret any sensitive data
Fields.FieldLabel: Process, store, or interpret any sensitive data
Fields.FieldText: Will the AI system process, store, or interpret any sensitive data (e.g., personal health information (PHI), personally identifiable information (PII) beyond basic contact details, financial data, biometric data, protected class information, classified data)?

Fields.FieldName: AI System Significance: Data Sensitivity & Privacy - Output directly or indirectly lead to decisions or actions that impact an individual's privacy rights
Fields.FieldText: Will the AI system's output directly or indirectly lead to decisions or actions that impact an individual's privacy rights (e.g., surveillance, profiling for targeted advertising, monitoring of online behavior)?

Fields.FieldName: AI System Significance - Critical Business Function & Impact - Calculations, make decisions, or provide recommendations that support a critical business function
Fields.FieldText: Will the AI system perform calculations, make decisions, or provide recommendations that support a critical business function (e.g., fraud detection, credit scoring, medical diagnosis, infrastructure management, legal compliance, safety-critical operations)?

Fields.FieldName: AI System Significance - Critical Business Function & Impact - Failure, error, or bias negitively impact organiation or individual
Fields.FieldText: Could a failure, error, or bias in the AI system's operation lead to significant financial loss, reputational damage, legal/regulatory penalties, or harm to individuals (e.g., physical harm, denial of services, unfair treatment)?

Fields.FieldName: AI System Significance: AI system is Significant
Fields.FieldText:
An AI system is considered 'Significant' and requires a more detailed risk assessment if:
- Any single question in Section 1 (Data Sensitivity & Privacy) or Section 2 (Critical Business Function & Impact) is answered 'Yes'.
- Three or more questions across all sections (excluding Section 1 and 2 if they triggered significance) are answered 'Yes'.
If the AI system is determined to be 'Significant', proceed with the detailed risk assessment. Otherwise, it can proceed with standard operational reviews.
Fields.DecisionFieldType: Option box with values:/Yes="Conduct a detialed AI System Risk Impact Assessment."/No="Conduct a AI System Risk Category Impact Assessment."

Fields.FieldName: AI System Significance: AI system is Significant
Fields.FieldLabel: FieldName = the field to interigate to determine the decision branch.
Fields.FieldText:
An AI system is considered 'Significant' and requires a more detailed risk assessment if:
- Any single question in Section 1 (Data Sensitivity & Privacy) or Section 2 (Critical Business Function & Impact) is answered 'Yes'.
- Three or more questions across all sections (excluding Section 1 and 2 if they triggered significance) are answered 'Yes'.
If the AI system is determined to be 'Significant', proceed with the detailed risk assessment. Otherwise, it can proceed with standard operational reviews.
Fields.YesTarget: Conduct a detialed AI System Risk Impact Assessments
Fields.NoTarget: Conduct a AI System Risk Category Impact Assessment

(A.5.3) Detailed AI System Risk Impact A.WebFormTitle: Conduct a detialed AI System Risk Impact Assessment

Fields.Control: 5.4 – Assessing AI system impact on individuals or groups of individuals
Fields.FieldName: (A.5.2, A.5.3, A.5.4, A.5.5) - EU AI Act Art 15||Risk - [Article 12] - Incomplete or Inconsistent Record-Keeping||Applicable Controls||[Art-12][Par-2][2] - Enable logging capabilities that record events related to risk identification, post-market monitoring, and operation monitoring of adopted AI systems.||[Accountability][Tech-1] Implement granular access control systems for AI development, deployment, and operational environments.
Fields.FieldQuestionGroup: Will this AI system generate decisions, recommendations, or outputs that the business may need to reference or justify later (e.g., for compliance, auditing, or disputes)?
Fields.FieldText: https://netblue4.github.io/AI-Onboarding/riskcontrolframework/Risk_Control_Framework_Browser.html

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2) - AI System Components - System architecture diagrams
Fields.FieldText: Location of AI System architecture diagrams

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2) - AI System Components - Data flow diagrams
Fields.FieldText: Location of AI Data flow diagrams

(A.4.4) AI Systems Software and Tooling.WebFormTitle: Define the software and tools used by the AI system.

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.4) - Tooling Resources - Tool Name and Version
Fields.FieldText: Name of the software, library, or framework and Version number.

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.4) - Tooling Resources - Category
Fields.FieldText: Category of the tool?
Fields.FieldType: Dropdown box with values:/Programming Language/IDE/Data Processing/ML Framework/Version Control/Deployment

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.4) - Tooling Resources - Purpose/Use Case in Project
Fields.FieldText: Tooling Resources: How this tool will be used in the AI system's lifecycle.

(A.4.5) AI Systems Computing Resources.WebFormTitle: Define the computing resources used by the AI system

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.5) - Computing Resources - Computing Resource Name and Version
Fields.FieldText: Name of the software, library, or framework.

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.5) - System & Computing Resources - Category
Fields.FieldText: Category of the computing resource.
Fields.FieldType: Dropdown box with values:/Dev Workstation/ML Training Cluster/Inference API Server/Data Lake Storage/EC2/S3/SQL Database

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.5) - System & Computing Resources - Lifecycle Phase(s) Supported
Fields.FieldText: Which part of the AI lifecycle does this resource supports?

(A.4.3) AI Systems Data Resources.WebFormTitle: Define the data resources used by the AI system

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.3) - Data Resources - Dataset Name
Fields.FieldText: Common or descriptive name of the dataset.

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.3) - Data Resources - Description
Fields.FieldText: Brief overview of the dataset's content and general purpose.

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.3, A.7.5) - Data Resources - Source
Fields.FieldText: Where does the data originate from?
Fields.FieldType: Dropdown box with values:/Internal database/Third-party vendor/Public repository/Synthetic generation

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.3) - Data Resources - Intended Use
Fields.FieldText: What is the specific purpose(s) of the data?
Fields.FieldType: Dropdown box with values:/Training data/Validation data/Test data/Production data

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.3) - Data Resources - Format
Fields.FieldText: What is the File format or storage system?

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.3) - Data Resources - Data Labeling
Fields.FieldText: How is the Data Labeled?

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.3, A.7.3,A.7.2) - Data Resources - Acquisition of data
Fields.FieldText: How will the Data be acquired and selected?
Fields.FieldType: Dropdown box with values:/Extracted from internal company databases (e.g., CRM, ERP)/Sourced from a publicly available dataset/Purchased or licensed from a third-party data provider/Collected directly from users with explicit consent/Scraped from public websites in compliance with terms of service/Streamed from IoT sensors or application logs/Artificially generated (synthetic data)/Selected based on defined quality and relevance criteria/Manually curated by subject matter experts/Sampled to ensure fair representation of subgroups (stratified sampling)/A combination of multiple sources/methods/Other (requires specific documentation)

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.3) - Data Resources - Retention Schedules
Fields.FieldText: What is the data Retention schedules based on legal and operational requirements?
Fields.FieldType: Dropdown box with values:/1 Year/5 Years/10 Years

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.3) - Data Resources - Secure Disposing
Fields.FieldText: Descripbe the Secure methods for disposing of obsolete or redundant data.

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.3) - Data Resources - Approximate Size
Fields.FieldText: What is the Estimated size of the data (e.g., number of records, GB, TB)?

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.3) - Data Resources - Access Method
Fields.FieldText: How will the data be accessed?
Fields.FieldType: Dropdown box with values:/S3 bucket path/API endpoint/Database query/Shared drive

Fields.FieldName: (A.4.2, A.4.3) - Data Resources - Owner/Custodian
Fields.FieldText: Person or team responsible for the data?

(A.7.4) AI System Data Quality Requireme.WebFormTitle: Define the AI system's Data Quality Requirements for Sensitive data

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.4) - Data Quality Requirements - Accuracy
Fields.FieldText: Specify the minimum acceptable accuracy level, defined as the percentage of data points that are correct when compared to a trusted source.

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.4) - Data Quality Requirements - Completeness
Fields.FieldText: Specify the required level of data completeness, ensuring that all necessary data fields are populated.
Fields.FieldType: Dropdown box with values:/All critical information present/No nulls in essential fields/> 98% completeness for important fields

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.4) - Data Quality Requirements - Consistency
Fields.FieldText: Define the requirement for data consistency, ensuring data is free from logical contradictions and maintains integrity across related datasets.
Fields.FieldType: Dropdown box with values:/No contradictory information/No logical contradictions/< 1% inconsistency rate

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.4) - Data Quality Requirements - Recency
Fields.FieldText: Specify how frequently the data must be updated to be considered current for its intended use.

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.4) - Data Quality Requirements - Source Traceability
Fields.FieldText: Specify whether the origin and history (provenance) of the data can be fully traced and verified.

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.4) - Data Quality Requirements - Versioning Applied
Fields.FieldText: Specify the system or method used to manage and track different versions of the dataset.

(A.7.6) AI System Data Preparation Plan.WebFormTitle: Define the AI system's Data Preparation Plan for Sensitive Data

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.2, A.7.6) - Data Preparation Plan for Sensitive Data - De-identification & Anonymization - Masking
Fields.FieldText: Replace parts of sensitive data with a generic character (e.g., 'XXX-XX-1234' for a Social Security Number).
Fields.FieldType: Option box with values:Applicable/ Not Applicable

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.2, A.7.6) - Data Preparation Plan for Sensitive Data - De-identification & Anonymization - Tokenization
Fields.FieldText: Replace a sensitive data element with a non-sensitive equivalent, referred to as a "token." The original data is stored in a secure vault.
Fields.FieldType: Option box with values:Applicable/ Not Applicable

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.2, A.7.6) - Data Preparation Plan for Sensitive Data - De-identification & Anonymization - Hashing
Fields.FieldText: Data Preparation Plan - Hashing||Use a cryptographic function to convert sensitive data into a fixed-size string of characters. It's a one-way process.
Fields.FieldType: Option box with values:Applicable/ Not Applicable

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.2, A.7.6) - Data Preparation Plan for Sensitive Data - De-identification & Anonymization - Generalization
Fields.FieldText: Reduce the precision of data. For example, changing a specific age ('34') to an age range ('30-40') or a full date of birth to just the year.
Fields.FieldType: Option box with values:Applicable/ Not Applicable

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.2, A.7.6) - Data Preparation Plan for Sensitive Data - Access Control & Governance - Data Segregation
Fields.FieldText: Create physically or logically separate data stores for sensitive information, with strict access controls.
Fields.FieldType: Option box with values:Applicable/ Not Applicable

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.2, A.7.6) - Data Preparation Plan for Sensitive Data - Access Control & Governance - Attribute-Based Access Control
Fields.FieldText: Apply rules so that only users with specific attributes (e.g., role, department) can access certain data fields.
Fields.FieldType: Option box with values:Applicable/ Not Applicable

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.2, A.7.6) - Data Preparation Plan for Sensitive Data - Data Minimization - Feature Pruning
Fields.FieldText: Remove any data fields or columns that are not strictly necessary for the AI model's purpose.
Fields.FieldType: Option box with values:Applicable/ Not Applicable

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.2, A.7.6) - Data Preparation Plan for Sensitive Data - Data Minimization
Fields.FieldText: Remove records of individuals who have not given consent for their data to be used for AI training.
Fields.FieldType: Option box with values:Applicable/ Not Applicable

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.2, A.7.6) - Data Preparation Plan for Sensitive Data - Quality & Integrity (Post-Anonymization) - Integrity Checks
Fields.FieldText: After de-identification, verify that relationships between anonymized fields (e.g., a tokenized user ID and their records) remain intact.
Fields.FieldType: Option box with values:Applicable/ Not Applicable

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.2, A.7.6) - Data Preparation Plan for Public Data - Data Cleaning & Quality - Handling Missing Values
Fields.FieldText: Remove empty or null fields, such as filling them with a mean/median/mode, or removing the row/column.
Fields.FieldType: Option box with values:Applicable/ Not Applicable

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.2, A.7.6) - Data Preparation Plan for Public Data - Data Cleaning & Quality - Correcting Inaccuracies
Fields.FieldText: Identify and fixing demonstrably incorrect data points (e.g., typos, out-of-range values like a temperature of '1000°C').
Fields.FieldType: Option box with values:Applicable/ Not Applicable

Fields.FieldName: (A.7.2, A.7.6) - Data Preparation Plan for Public Data - Data Cleaning & Quality - Removing Duplicates
Fields.FieldText: Identify and deleting redundant records from the dataset.
Fields.FieldType: Option box with values:Applicable/ Not Applicable

(A.8.4) AI System Documentation and User.WebFormTitle: Define and document the information, reporting, and incident communication plan for all internal and external interested parties.

Fields.FieldName: (A.8.4) - Incident Communication Plan - Data Breach
Fields.FieldText: Describe how incidents related to "Unintended exposure of training data" will be comunicated.

Fields.FieldName: (A.8.4) - Incident Communication Plan - Model Misuse
Fields.FieldText: Describe how incidents related to "AI model used outside intended scope" will be comunicated.

Fields.FieldName: (A.8.4) - Incident Communication Plan - Model Failure
Fields.FieldText: Describe how incidents related to "False predictions causing harm" will be comunicated.

(A.8.5) Information for interested parti.WebFormTitle: Establish a process to manage all stakeholder relationships, ensuring that responsibilities are clearly allocated, supplier activities align with internal AI policies, and customer needs are fully considered.

Fields.FieldName: (A.8.5, A.8.3) - Interested parties - Name
Fields.FieldText: List the Interested parties who receive reporting information about the AI system.

Fields.FieldName: (A.8.5, A.8.3) - Interested parties - Primary Point of Contact
Fields.FieldText: List the Interested parties Primary Point of Contact [Name, Title, Email]

Fields.FieldName: (A.8.5, A.8.3) - Interested parties - General Description of Involvement
Fields.FieldText: Briefly describe the reporting obligation to the Interested parties.

(A.6.1.2) Objectives for Responsible and.WebFormTitle: Describe the Responsible and Ethical objectives to guide the development of AI systems

Fields.Control: A.6.1.2 – Objectives for responsible development of AI system
Fields.FieldName: (A.6.1.2, A.6.2.3) - Responsible AI Objectives Development - Human-Centric
Fields.FieldText: To design the AI system to support, assist, and augment human capabilities and decision-making processes, prioritizing human well-being and agency.

Fields.Control: A.6.1.2 – Objectives for responsible development of AI system
Fields.FieldName: (A.6.1.2, A.6.2.3) - Responsible AI Objectives Development - Transparency and Explainability
Fields.FieldText: To ensure the AI system provides clear, understandable information about its purpose, processes, and decisions to all relevant stakeholders.

Fields.Control: A.6.1.2 – Objectives for responsible development of AI system
Fields.FieldName: (A.6.1.2, A.6.2.3) - Responsible AI Objectives Development - Human Oversight
Fields.FieldText: To implement meaningful human oversight mechanisms that allow for monitoring system performance, reviewing high-risk decisions, and intervening effectively when necessary.

Fields.Control: A.6.1.2 – Objectives for responsible development of AI system
Fields.FieldName: (A.6.1.2, A.6.2.3) - Responsible AI Objectives Development - Fairness and Non-discrimination
Fields.FieldText: To identify, assess, and mitigate biases in data and models throughout the AI lifecycle to prevent discriminatory or unjust outcomes for individuals or groups.

Fields.Control: A.6.1.2 – Objectives for responsible development of AI system
Fields.FieldName: (A.6.1.2, A.6.2.3) - Responsible AI Objectives Development - Accountability
Fields.FieldText: To establish a clear governance structure with defined roles and responsibilities for the AI system's outcomes, including accessible mechanisms for redress and remediation.

Fields.Control: A.6.1.2 – Objectives for responsible development of AI system
Fields.FieldName: (A.6.1.2, A.6.2.3) - Responsible AI Objectives Development - Safety and Robustness
Fields.FieldText: To ensure the AI system is resilient, operates reliably and safely under a variety of conditions, and minimizes the risk of unintended harm or failure.

Fields.Control: A.6.1.2 – Objectives for responsible development of AI system
Fields.FieldName: (A.6.1.2, A.6.2.3) - Responsible AI Objectives Development - Security
Fields.FieldText: To implement comprehensive security measures to protect the AI system, its models, and its data from unauthorized access, manipulation, and adversarial attacks.

Fields.Control: A.6.1.2 – Objectives for responsible development of AI system
Fields.FieldName: (A.6.1.2, A.6.2.3) - Responsible AI Objectives Development - Privacy
Fields.FieldText: To incorporate privacy-preserving techniques into the AI system's design to protect personal data throughout its lifecycle and ensure compliance with data protection regulations.

Fields.Control: A.6.1.2 – Objectives for responsible development of AI system
Fields.FieldName: (A.6.1.2, A.6.2.3) - Responsible AI Objectives Development - Sustainability
Fields.FieldText: To measure and minimize the environmental impact of the AI system by optimizing computational resources and energy consumption during its training and operation.

(A.6.2.6, A.6.2.8) AI system recording o.WebFormTitle: Define the events to be logged when the AI system is in use and how they will ensure the Responsible and Ethical use of AI systems.

Fields.FieldName: (A.6.2.6, A.6.2.8) - AI system recording of event logs and monitoring - Human-Centric
Fields.FieldText: Describe the event logging and monitoring in place during the AI system's use phase to track user interactions, system assists, and human overrides. Detail how these logs will be used to monitor the system's impact on human capabilities and decision-making.

Fields.FieldName: ((A.6.2.6, A.6.2.8) - AI system recording of event logs and monitoring - Transparency and Explainability
Fields.FieldText: Describe the event logging mechanisms implemented during the AI system's use phase to record inputs, outputs, and explanations generated. Explain how these logs will be monitored to verify the ongoing accuracy and completeness of the system's decisions.

Fields.FieldName: (A.6.2.6, A.6.2.8) - AI system recording of event logs and monitoring - Human Oversight
Fields.FieldText: Describe the event logging and monitoring processes established for the AI system's use phase to capture high-risk decisions. Detail how these logs will be used to support human reviews, approves, or intervenes in a high-risk decision.

Fields.FieldName: (A.6.2.6, A.6.2.8) - AI system recording of event logs and monitoring - Fairness and Non-Discrimination
Fields.FieldText: Describe the event logging and performance monitoring procedures in place during the AI system's use phase to assess fairness. Detail how system outputs are logged against key demographic subgroups to continuously monitor for and address potential biases.

Fields.FieldName: (A.6.2.6, A.6.2.8) - AI system recording of event logs and monitoring - Accuracy, Robustness, and Cybersecurity
Fields.FieldLabel: EU AI Act Art 15 - Accuracy, Robustness, and Cybersecurity
Fields.FieldText: Describe the event logging and monitoring strategy for the AI system's use phase. Detail what specific events will be recorded to monitor technical performance, accuracy drift, system uptime, security events (e.g., potential adversarial inputs), and overall operational robustness.

AI Systems development objective and rol.WebFormTitle: Define Objective and roles for Development

Fields.FieldName: Development Roles
Fields.FieldText: Development roles: ???

Fields.FieldName: Development objectives
Fields.FieldText: Development objectives: ???

Fields.FieldName: Development measures
Fields.FieldText: Development measures: ???

(A.6.2.4) AI Systems verifications.WebFormTitle: Document verification and validation measures for the AI system and specify criteria for their use.

Fields.FieldName: (A.6.2.4) - AI Systems verifications - Human-Centric
Fields.FieldText: Describe the verification and validation measures (e.g., user acceptance testing, efficiency metrics, user feedback surveys) and the specific criteria used to confirm the AI system effectively supports human capabilities and well-being.

Fields.FieldName: (A.6.2.4) - AI Systems verifications - Transparency and Explainability
Fields.FieldText: Detail the verification and validation methods (e.g., user testing of explanation features, review by subject matter experts) and criteria used to ensure system outputs are understandable and interpretable by the intended audience.

Fields.FieldName: (A.6.2.4) - Verification of - Human Oversight
Fields.FieldText: Describe the measures and criteria used to verify that the human oversight mechanisms are effective. This should include how you validate that reviewers have the necessary information and tools to intervene (e.g., via simulated scenarios, usability testing of oversight interfaces).

Fields.FieldName: (A.6.2.4) - AI Systems verifications - Fairness and Non-Discrimination
Fields.FieldText: Detail the specific metrics (e.g., demographic parity, equalized odds) and statistical tests used to verify fairness across demographic subgroups. Specify the acceptable performance thresholds and provide evidence from your validation dataset.

Fields.FieldName: (A.6.2.4) - AI Systems verifications - Accuracy, Robustness, and Cybersecurity
Fields.FieldText:
Describe the measures for verifying system performance. Specify the metrics and acceptance criteria for: 
1. Accuracy (e.g., precision, recall on a test set). 
2. Robustness (e.g., performance on adversarial examples, stress tests). 
3. Cybersecurity (e.g., results of penetration testing, vulnerability scans).

AI Systems use objective and roles.WebFormTitle: Define Objective and roles for Use

Fields.FieldName: Usage roles
Fields.FieldText: Usage roles: ???

Fields.FieldName: Usage objectives
